description: From Latin lysis, from Ancient Greek λύσις (lúsis, “a loosening”). Compare -lysis.

entries.meaning: (medicine, pathology) A gradual recovery from disease (opposed to crisis).
examples: The older medicine used to speak of two ways, lysis and crisis, one gradual, the other abrupt, in which one might recover from a bodily disease.

entries.meaning: (biochemistry) The disintegration or destruction of cells
(biochemistry) The breakdown of molecules into constituent molecules
(architecture) A plinth or step above the cornice of the podium in an ancient temple.
